remarks: An onto function implies dominance of domain over range, for finite sets.  Unlike ~ fodom for arbitrary sets, this theorem does not require the Axiom of Choice for its proof.  (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 16-Nov-2014.)
statement: fodomfi $p |- ( ( A e. Fin /\ F : A -onto-> B ) -> B ~<_ A ) $.
